39353074.review:
1.5 hours of playtime, nice interacting with objects and environment, nice sound.

No story at all, no characters, no dialogues. Just a room and a bathroom (no bed?), you follow some hints and have to find some hidden keys, and that's it. I expected more from a game with 94% positive reviews, maybe people in 2016 just had really low expectations but now I need more to enjoy something in VR than just some nice interacting with things.
There is nothing here to inspire you or to impress you, or that really makes you feel smart, just a "ok, I found it, is this all?" experience.

The game is well done, but it's not fun or satisfying enough to be worth the 4.50€ I paid for it.

39306359.review:
WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
Abode is an 'escape the room' game, that is you are locked in a room and need to escape by solving puzzles. Abode has a main room and a side room and you have to find keys and codes for various machinery to progress through the game. You teleport around, investigate items, put object A into object B and so on. 

VISUALS
Abode has a sort of comic style visual design, everything is quite stylized. The room you are in is a weird mix of sci-fic tech (floating screen) and old-style stuff (like a record player) which I found a bit strange, but overall the objects are well-designed and colored.

SOUND
There isn't much in the terms of sound; there is background noise like cars driving by and then some sounds when interacting with objects. The sound fits the game nice though so no complaints here.

CONTROLS
You don't have hands but some stylized controller-type things which have only one small point with which to take things which I found a bit annoying. Grabbing and using objects was a bit awkward sometimes since larger objects get stuck on walls or other objects and fall out of hand. Also there are three keys for different locks which look identical but can only be used on one of the locks which leads to lots of trying out how to make a key fit. There is an inventory system which I found to be more distracting than useful. 

GAMEPLAY
There is no story as such, as is often the case in escape games (other than "you need to escape!"). The puzzles are well designed overall if sometimes a bit obscure (The plant! OMG!). The puzzles don't make "sense" in the real world and are not logically connected, but simply a string of challenges; I personally would have liked are more logical way to escape but there are some really nice puzzle ideas in there. 

BOTTOM LINE
If you like escape games, then this is a good one and provides a nice challenge.

39273599.review:
[h1]Basic Puzzles, Holds Your Hand Too Much[/h1]
I bought [i]Abode[/i] because I thought it looked like a fun escape-room style game. To make sure I played with no spoilers I actively avoided watching any videos associated with the game until I had finished my playthrough. I wish I hadn't bothered waiting.

While [i]Abode[/i] is part of the escape-room genre, it's far too much of a tutorial into what escape-rooms are rather than an actual challenge. To understand why, I'll have to explain out some spoilers to the game, so I'll break the spoilers into 2 categories:
[list]
[*](Puzzle Elements) - Objects necessarry to complete the escape-room challenge are discussed. Solutions to the appropriate use of these objects are not. These spoilers will probably give you some hints as to what objects you should focus on.
[*](Puzzle Solutions) - Solution uses of objects are discussed. Clues unlocked along the way and hidden puzzle elements are discussed here. These spoilers will most definitely ruin your ability to play the game with a clean slate.
[/list]

[b][u]The Format Of [i]Abode[/i]'s Escape-Room[/u][/b]
The gameplay used to escape the room is divided into two parts: (Puzzle Solutions)[spoiler]destruction of everything followed by following the 'clues'.
In engaging in absolute chaos you just need to make sure that no stone is left unturned. Empty every container, open every drawer, and move every object that can be moved. You should find the bathroom key and the entire first set of rings. And you don't even need the bathroom key you found to get in.[/spoiler] The game has no safeguards against walking through the door, other than a dimmed display during the brief second you're clipping through it.
(Puzzle Solutions)[spoiler]The first set of rings will set you up for the second phase. Simply insert as instructed and each one awards you a clue that will lead you to a second set of rings. With the second set of rings and the world code, you have everything needed to open the final safe and get the exit key.[/spoiler]

[b][u]The Individual Puzzles[/u][/b]
The puzzles in [i]Abode[/i] almost all lack any sort of challenge. And it's because of the 'clues'. In playing this escape-room, I feel like only a couple of the clues this game includes actually have any merit to be a part of the experience. Almost all of them are holding your hand and removing all of the challenge in the game. You could argue that clues like (Puzzle Elements)[spoiler]the cracked brick[/spoiler] are necessary when players get stuck. I agree with that, but ones like that should be delayed and identified as a [b]hints[/b] to help you keep moving, separate from the [b]clues[/b] which are necessary to finish the challenge. And with puzzles like (Puzzle Solutions)[spoiler]the bathroom physical, where the password is obtained from an obviously and easily coded phone message, and one of the 'clues' is literally just telling you to do the physical,[/spoiler] there's no feeling of success when you advance because the steps taken just seemed obvious or were given in exact directions.

Because the game is so straightforward (Puzzle Solutions)[spoiler]once you just start destroying everythings[/spoiler] I find little reason to recommend it to anyone in its current state.

39192216.review: Awesome, relaxing game. Puzzles are fun and I really enjoyed playing with everything to figure them out.

39159527.review:
[i]I played this game using a HTC Vive [/i]
This is an amazing "Escape The Room" kind of game, which took me about an hour to complete.
Every small object that should be interactable IS interactable in this game.
This makes it very satisfying to pick object every single object and look for clues.
Movement is also very good, and the game makes use of elevation as well.
Having you look at things up top and at floor level too. 
The only downside in my opinion is the price (€10) for only one hour of playtime.


[h1]Positive Points: [/h1]
- Great visuals/environment
- Good puzzles
- In-game hints


[h1]Negative points:[/h1]
- One hour of playtime (for me)
- It costs €10


[h1]tl;dr[/h1]
It's a very good game, had no issues with it on a HTC Vive, but it has a rather high pricetag.
I'd say the game is worth it, but I bought it during a Winter Sale for a reduced price.

39135971.review: I think Abode is an excellent VR experience and makes really good use of the platform. You are out in a room that you have to solve puzzles and escape from. Good variety in the puzzles and interactivity is top notch. Highly recommended for the short but excellent experience.

38989261.review: This is a really solid "escape the room" style puzzle in vr. The puzzles are very fun to figure out and don't fall into the trap of many point and clicks with very obtuse solutions. While this game is not very long (took me a little under an hour to finish) I would reccomend this to anyone who likes this sort of game just for the very solid execution.

38987638.review: Got this on sale, and it was definitely worth $5. Has bugs and you might need to load your save a few times, but don't spend all your time just solfing the puzzles; try to enjoy the scene and see what you can do in the room.

38947431.review: Quick game as a personal "escape room" experience, definitely doable in less than 60 minutes. Overall okay but several times where objects that got to the floor were harder to pick up or you questioned if you should be able to do more with VR capabilities.

38865058.review: Liked it until I ran into a gamebreaking bug where one of the key items got stuck in my inventory. Until that point however it was a fairly enjoyable escape room thingy.

38832849.review: Short game, couple hours at most, but quite good.

38762171.review:
I enjoyed this but my brother freaked out over the bugs.
Buy if you like buggy puzzles.

38601138.review:
It's about an hour long, although it took me longer because I was stuck on a puzzle. I've played a lot of VR games so the novelty has worn off on me and I'm pickier, but this was still quite good. I was surprised at how much I enjoyed being in a room despite VR novelty being gone, but then again I love the menu room in superhot. There is something very satisfying about thoroughly exploring a small space in vr. I hope more people make VR escape the room games. 
There aren't many games like it so $10 isn't terrible, but if you can get it on sale for $5 or so then I highly recommend it. After trying this I'm excited to try their other similar game "Conductor". I'll update the review after I do. 

Oh one negative, I found the ending funny and I'm sure my friends will too, but it will be offensive to some. I was playing the game and the whole time thinking "my family will love for me to demo this to them over Christmas", but the ending kind of makes it impossible to demo it to some people (ex: my relatives). There should be an option to disable it or change it.

38592072.review:
Fun escape with nice variety of puzzles! Great environmental interactions, nice graphics.

Be aware that it's a relative short game, probably about an hour.

Only complaint is that physics glitches can cause certain important objects to fly across the room or get lost. When this happened to me, I restarted the game and they returned to their original positions.

38573314.review:
Abode is a short and sweet puzzle game.

Graphics might not be the best, but they are stylized appropriately, which does not make the game feel like cheap low poly shovelware. 

Puzzles are well done, and there are none where you would get stuck for hours and succumb into frustration, but the game still does not feel to easy.

Beatable in 1 hour.

For sure one of the best puzzle games on the market if you don't consider the size.

38377870.review:
There isn't much to say about this game really.

Playtime: Around 1 hour.
Playspace: 2.5x2.5 should do well enough.

Easy 100%,  everything works fine and it's solid all around.

The price point is a little high for the amount of value you get but if you grab it onsale or love room escape games it's well worth the price.

Bottom line: If you are a room escape fan it is worth your money if not than it probably wont sell you on the genre.
===================
Make up your own mind about it.
DanielJMWaters.

36670530.review: Relatively short, but solid escape room puzzles.

36633705.review: This game is my first experience doing Escape Rooms at all, let alone in VR. It was a changing experience as I have now bought over 5 other vr escape rooms and done a real one in real life. All this because the puzzles are so darn good in this game! Get it its so cool!

36611578.review:
The game is a hidden gem. In short: That's how 'room riddle games' should look like.

You are in a room and have to find a way out of it.  
So far so common, but even though the experience can be finished in around an hour it was worth every cent.
The game is never unfair and invites you on an interesting quest to solve the puzzle.
There is much to discover and stuff to try out.

The game has now a place in my VR showcase. 
I recommend it to everybody who has no problem with a short but powerful VR experience

36601894.review: Short experience with a few interesting puzzles.  Despite the few interesting puzzles you wont feel like you have accomplished much after it is all said and done.

36500905.review: One of the best VR games to date!

35617334.review:
An intelligent and addictive game that quietly and brilliantly showcases a number of ideas that illustrate what's fantastic about VR. I love games where you're put in an unfamiliar situation and have to figure things out with a bit of detective work. The physical interactions to the puzzles and exploration are just right and the game intrigues and delights in equal measure. I played it through in one sitting (standing?) and was spellbound from beginning to end.

Conductor, by the same developers, is similarly brilliant; even better, in fact.

35604306.review: Honestly, this was the best VR escape room I've ever played. Atmospheric, clever puzzles, a lot of interactable stuff - awesome!

35556513.review:
Nice, wer sich mit der Grafik anfreunden kann hat eine Stunde Rätselspaß in VR.
Schade nur, dass man es nur einmal spielen kann.

35541388.review: I like the game and the concept, but it is too short. 'Conductor' from the same company offers better story. 10 euros for 1 hour it's too high. For a lower price it is a nice short experience.

35527719.review: If you like escape games, this is right up your alley.  Very reasonably priced, takes roughly an hour or so to complete.  Given that escape games are about $24-$30, this game is a deal.  The controls are pretty tight, very few glitches, puzzles are clever and rewarding.  Could've done without the "Secret ending", but overall excellent game.

35394597.review: Very good take on an escape the room game. If you like this kind of genre, then I would personally recccomend this title

35215134.review: This has to be the best escape room in VR right now. It has a high degree of polish, a decent length, great atmosphere, and interesting and varied puzzles. If you're trying to decide on an escape room game, this is the one.

35192055.review: Short but fun escape room.  Simple puzzles, few minor bugs and a pleasant atmosphere.  Wish there was more to it.

35126969.review: i have just got round to completing this game - i can hands down say i had a good time - thankyou

35017169.review:
Noch ein Escaperoomspiel? Ja, aber eines der Besseren! Man fühlt sich gleich richtig drin. Die Interaktion mit den Objekten im Spiel funktioniert sehr gut. Die Physik stimmt, auch die Beleuchtung ist einwandfrei. Das alles trägt zu einer sehr dichten Atmosphäre bei, die dem Spiel sehr gut gelingt. Man ist eben gleich mittendrin. Die Rätzel sind nicht allzu schwer zu lösen, sodaß kein Frust entsteht.
Ich liebe solche Art der Spiele und freu mich auf ein richtig großes Spiel in der Art.

P.S. Conductor ist genauso gut, evtl. sogar noch besser

34925163.review:
[h1][b]Great VR-Puzzle Game[/b][/h1]


[b][u]Pro[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]Interesting and mildly challenging Puzzles
[/list]
([i]Challenging, but not "Let me check a walktrough"-Challenging[/i])
[list]
[*]Great interactivity. You can pick up almost every single thing. 
[*]Clean textures. For me personally way better than wannabe photorealism.
[*]Justifiable price
[/list]
[b][u]Con[/u][/b]
[list]
[*]Short playtime
[*]Too much background Noise
[/list]
[i]	(Sometimes it feels like you're standing between a Highway and an Airport)[/i]


[b][u]Conclusion[/u][/b]
Abode is the best VR escape the room game i have played. Its puzzles can lead to the occasional head-scratching, but will award you with another piece to the greater puzzle, which will motivate you to keep playing. Its progression is neither too fast nor too slow ([i]as long as you have a functioning and problem-solvable brain[/i]), so you won't have reason to take of the headset to think about how you move on.
While it is a short game with an completion time of around an Hour, it is certainly worth the 10$, especially when buying the bundle with Conductor, since its been developed by only two guys who created a solid VR-experience.


[b][u]If you have the money to spend, buy it![/u][/b]

34892143.review: Fun little "escape the room" experience with some interesting puzzles! Took me about an hour to solve.

34631767.review: If you can get it for a couple dollars, sure, go for it.  It is indeed just an 'escape room' like you would play in real life.  Interesting to try, I suppose, but there's literally no payoff.  It's a one time deal and $10 is way too much for what is essentially an experimental VR title.  There are free titles with just as much content or more.

34539308.review: Played this as a family and loved it. Only grouch was that it let us out to early without solving a few puzzles. Lots to do and explore and the right level of difficulty  for me and the family.

34493868.review: A short room escape puzzle that works brilliantly in VR. My playtime is a bit inflated as I left the game paused to take a break near the end. While I wish it was longer, what's there is good from start to finish, with no filler and bunch of well thought-out puzzles in a space which is fun to explore. I didn't get all the puzzles immediately, but didn't get stuck on any or need to look up solutions either. If you can't solve one right away, you can walk around and solve other things and come back. Difficulty seems perfect to me. Price seems OK given the small market for VR games and the polished experience. Probably not much replay value, but that's inherent in the genre. Maybe I'll play it again in a year when I've forgotten the solutions.

34373507.review:
Great escape room! Puzzles aren't too difficult but still fun enough that you have to be very observant and require some lateral thinking.

Takes about an hour to complete for one person, has 8 achievements that are easy enough to get as well.

Probably no replay value for one person who has completed it already, but I absolutely will have a lot of friends and family play this game on their own as an introduction to VR and mechanics, as the gravity and object physics are on point.

Absolutely would recommend! Great experience!

34366272.review:
~1 hour completion time

I enjoyed this. It's your typical "Escape the Room" game like you'd find on Kongregate, but with a nearly fully-interactive VR environment. No puzzle was too obscure or unfair. I'm going to keep this on my hard drive for awhile so that friends can try it out.

I do wish there had been something of an ending though.

34320297.review:
I don't know why I've never reviewed Abode. Oh wait I do. It's because originally the ending was a bit insulting. Which was a shame because this is one of the most welcoming VR room escape games that I can think of and one of the few that doesn't aim for a horror setting. 
THANKFULLY- They fixed it! And now I can say I love Abode. Watching a friend work their way through it is almost as much fun as playing yourself. It's a short experience but one that I think is well polished and one where the connections and the solving happen relatively quickly and so it's pay-off after pay-off until 50ish to 60ish minutes later your time with Abode is done. It's well worth picking up. 
And I really hope they do a sequel, yes I'm aware of Conductor, but a sequel that brings a little more story to this hip jazzy world would be most welcome.

34117022.review: A fun escape room game.  The atmosphere is great, the art has style, and the puzzles are good.  Not a big long game, but enough to keep you busy for a long afternoon.  Well worth the price.

34060564.review: Short about 1.5 hours and that is with exploring th eentire room. That being said I think it is a really good game, would have liked more things to do, I am glad I got it on sale. Like others have mentioned the items can jump across the room making it hard to find them, but in my game the items were reset when I reloaded the game.

34035701.review:
Escape-Room vom Feinsten.
Abode ist wirklich ein gut gelungenes Spiel. Die Grafik, die Rätsel, Steuerung, alles passt.
Mit etwa einer Stunde gameplay (klar, abhängig von den eigenen Fähigkeiten) eines der größeren Spiele dieses Genres, und dabei habe ich die Erfolge nichtmal freigeschaltet.
Ich hatte keinerlei Framedrops, Trackingverluste oder ähnliches (GTX 970, i5) zu beklagen.
Habe es im Sale erworben, von daher bereue ich keinen Cent.
Für mich eine klare Kaufempfehlung für Fans solcher Spiele.

Gruß
Ziffi

Ziffi als Kurator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

33997329.review: This was a cracking puzzle room game. It lasted about an hour but I was scratching my head the whole time. A great experiance for £5.

33748598.review: Its only like an hour long but its a pretty well made escape the room game.  Not too hard, not too easy.  Gotta get it only on a good sale though since its only an hour long...

33658755.review:
Short but nifty little "Escape the Room"-esk game where you solve small puzzles around the room to get glowing rings, which unlocks both hints where to find more rings as well as the "final puzzle".

Got a little stuck where I couldn't find one last piece, but after rummaging around the room and checking behind every corner I was able to complete the game and score all achievements!

Totally recommend to grab this game to have a little brain tease, and here's hope that more devs create more games like this!

33543587.review:
So this was the first real game I played in VR away from the basic stuff that Valve has out for introduction. I played for around 2 hours but It did take me a while to set things up and get used to everything so actual playtime is shorter than that.

Although this is the first VR  game I have played and therefore I don't have anything to compare it to, I think this is a well made little indie game. I generally enjoy puzzle games and I thought it would be fun to try out an escape room type game. It's a pretty straight forward one and it's not difficult at all but the fun in this for me mainly came from the ability you have to really explore and search every nook and cranny. It's a lot more personal and immersive being able to literally crouch down and look under the sofa, or peer into a fish tank to look for fishies.

In terms of play space I don't really have any room to move around, yet I still found it enjoyable to play. I just had to be a bit more careful. As my computer isn't quite up to scratch I use my dads computer whenever I can to get in some VR gaming. It being in the family house it's pretty hard to get used to knowing you look like a right tit looking under imaginary sofas or banging imaginary drums (which were in the other game I tried during this sesh) and hearing a voice in the distance laugh and go "You having fun there?". 
Why, yes. Yes I am.

I was quite satisfied with this game and the amount of things in it that you could interact with. I imagine there is nothing more disappointing in VR than going to pick something up or interact with something and finding out you can't. Anything that I wanted to look at in this game gave me the choice to, so I was quite pleased with that.

Overall I think this was a fun little game for anyone looking for a quick little puzzle or even just a basic VR game to start off with. I found the graphics were good, which is important in VR, and the sound quite immersive, so I would definitely recommend this one. It's short but sweet.


TL;DR : It's a simple, short and immersive little puzzle game, great for beginners to VR or people who enjoy puzzle games. The graphics are good on the eyes, the sound is immersive and the puzzles aren't that hard but the environment is fun to rummage around in.

33543072.review:
Si vous aimez les escape game et que vous avez un casque VR, n'hésitez pas, vraiment une super expérience.
Les énigmes sont vraiment sympas. 
Tellement bon qu'on en veut plus, si il y a une suite ou tout simplement une autre salle en DLC, je prendrai direct !

33539081.review: Bon petit escape room (1-2h) ! Enigmes variées et pas trop dures, seul bémol un bug bloquant qui m'a fait perdre 15min car ne déclenché pas une énigme alors on pense mal faire les choses... un redémarrage et c'était réglé!

32934019.review: Fun game in a pleasant Noire setting. There is alot of interaction not related to the puzzles which I enjoy. It adds to the realizm

32791435.review:
Really good straight foward exploration for clue and trying to get out.
Gravity is well done and the manipulation are quite good.
I really enjoyed this one.

32743084.review: Great escape room game.  Not the most complex but clever and fun.  Completed in about an hour.  Would recommend.

32742856.review:
A solid "EScape the room" nice theme, puzzles are the ride that line between requiring a bit of logical thinking and never stray into "Moonlogic" 

Solidly put together, if you want a Escape the Room fun you cant go far wrong with this one :)

32461722.review:
Muito bem feito.
Com desafios que vão desde fáceis até difíceis.

32361004.review: Очень интересный пазл. Нужно найти разные предметы в комнате. Рекомендую!

32349831.review:
Highly recommended! I've played a bunch of VR escape rooms and this is my favorite! Great style and the puzzles are just the right amount of challange to be satisfying without being frustrating. Lots of puzzles in the game, so there's plenty to do. Takes about 45 minutes if you consistently make progress.

PRO TIP: If you teleport and seem to lose an important object you were carrying, check your inventory!

32342348.review: This is a fun, polished and immersive VR escape room style game.  It is my favorite of the genre so far.  I go to a lot of real life escape rooms and am used to paying $25 or more for one hour of entertainment so $10 is well worth it in my opinion.

32028411.review: I was extremely hopeful to play another VR Escape game, but there were several small objects required in-game that were unobtainable if dropped on the floor.  I made several attempts to adjust the floor height in SteamVR, but when I would re-enter the game, the floor would still be too low leaving the items unreachable.  Unfortunately the items were needed to progress.  I requested a refund since I wasn't able to play.  :(  By the way, this is the only VR game with which I have had this problem where I was unable to resolve it by perfoming some tweaks in SteamVR.

32024529.review: For the price a fun 45 minute escape the room puzzle, the end gag is pretty great too!

32000303.review: There were a few glitches along the way, but this is my favorite escape room style game so far. It is a relatively short experience (possible to speed through in 30 minutes or so), but it was very enjoyable. After I completed the game I had my wife play through it and she enjoyed it as well. The puzzles vary in difficulty and some are pretty clever.

31821745.review: Doesn't have controls to reach far objects like in the game "I Expect You to Die".

31741164.review:
Took about an hour, really good well thought out puzzles. Lots of variety to each puzzle and they weren't too easy or difficult. Love how immersive this feels in VR, being able to grab twist and turn everything. 

The breakeable objects, functional taps and details of dust in the air were a nice touch. Game crashed once, but it autosaved to about 5 minutes before that point in time. Easy enough to regain progress anyway. 

The ending could be better and there was no purpose so to speak, except go from puzzle to puzzle. I would highly recommend this game for any one who enjoys escape rooms or puzzle games.

31643630.review:
It's pretty good, but be aware that there are some progression blocking glitches. Be VERY careful with the decryption paper, when I played it disappeared from my hand while I was walking(I suspect it hit the door as I was walking out) and was gone from the world completely. Without that I couldn't continue.

Aside from that though, this is one of the better escape VR games I've played.

31630340.review: Nice game , could be a bit more polished (sound wise and interaction is a bit fiddly) with more interesting end, but in all i like it. I hope they learned on this one and use knowledge on next game.

31610977.review: Great puzzles and native VR interactivity. I love how the music is handled through an in-world record player.  A little crashy, but it automatically saves your progress, so its not too frustrating.

31587723.review:
Abode is a well built "escape room" with many puzzles and riddles.

Some things could be optimized, but it doesn't take a way too much from the experience.

My biggest gripe with this game was the ending. [spoiler]There simply is no ending. When you complete all the puzzles and finally open the door, you enter a hallway with a framed credits message, a window on one side, and an open door on the other side. The door doesn't lead anywhere, the wall just continues through the door hole.[/spoiler] I didn't feel like I accomplished anything by solving all the puzzles. There was no "escape" factor.

31582977.review:
What a fun little mystery game. Haven't finished it yet but every part I did I enjoyed so far - wish there was more storyline and what not but what there is to do all works. I like putting on the hat and smoking the stogie while I detect things.

Will check out their new game after playing this. Good stuff.

31537423.review:
Definitely one of the best VR escape rooms yet!
Real puzzles, not a simple search for items.

31475130.review: High quality puzzle game with a decent amount of content. Felt a bit like Deckard in Blade Runner. Wish I could look out the window tho.

31438472.review: Great but short escape room game.

31406790.review: The best escape the room I've played to date.  A variety of different interactable objects and puzzles. Occaisionally items will get flung around the room due to physics collisions, but restarting the game usually fixes the problem.  It took me about an hour to complete.

31349918.review: Polished, large, fun escape room with a good hint system that rewards exploration.

31223032.review:
ok it s polished, you ask 10eur / 1.3  hours...

no ambiance, no soul, strange universe choice with no appeal but yeah it's polished.

for  escape-room aficionados only. I give a 7/10 cause i am cool

31163329.review:
This has been my favorite VR "escape room" so far. The puzzles were varied and nothing was overly difficult or unfair. The included clues made it much more enjoyable, as I've been stuck in other games simply because I missed something very basic.

At first, the interaction and inventory system wasn't clear to me, but that only lasted a minute, and then it made sense and worked well.

One of my favorite features was the record player, as it lets you choose from a couple songs and then set the volume.

Took me just over 45 minutres to complete, including the achievements (which were fun and simple). To me, it was worth the $10, and like any game in this genre, you get more value with friends/family that can play as well.

31157582.review: For me this game lacked. The puzzles where all fine, but there didn't appear to be any reason for doing any of it - it lacks any storyline, and also lacks a conclusion.

31154592.review: There have been many low effort room-escape games for the Vive, but this was one of the first that felt like a complete, professional experience.  Object interaction feels solid, lighting is great, inventory system works well (feels a bit like Budget Cuts).  The atmosphere/environment is incredibly immersive. The puzzles are diverse and interesting, and will make you think but not leave you frustratedly checking walkthroughs.  This game has me believing that room escape games can be a serious, lasting genre in VR, not just a novelty.  I hope to be escaping rooms again from these guys soon!

31011868.review: I like this one. The style is nice. The puzzles are good. Not too hard but there are a few tricky tricks. The only problem is that there is zero plot. No story. No beginning and no ending. Makes me want to see a story game from this developer. Maybe you're a detective in a cyberpunk future. It has that feels.

31006396.review: It's a good game, very well made. However the pipes aren't working and we spent a good hour trying to get them to work. A youtube walkthrough video shows they should just snap together. Unfortunatly it seems to be bugged and we couldn't complete the game.

30969221.review: A fun VR escape room game that can also be a fun toss everything around the room game. Lots of interactable objects.

30863882.review:
Awesome game!

Put the gold in the safe for best ending :)

30759089.review:
I find it really short (finished in around 30 minute), probably a bit too expensive for what it is, but much better than other escape roo I've tried in VR (a part the tube part was buggy it wasn't magnetize for a reason)
I still recommend it.
The movement is teleportation, and that's what I like most. (no motion sickness! :D)

30628932.review: BRAVO!!! I loved this game. I do a lot of IRL escape rooms, and this kept me puzzled for a while. It felt very polished and the riddles were fun.

30598761.review:
All in all great game :) Showed it to my friends during a VR evening and I said it wouldn't be much fun in doing an escape-room style game but man I was wrong! Everyone was literally glued to the mirrored screen trying to help the one who was wearing the headset. 

Great experience and would actually recommend to try this together with friends :)!

30496706.review:
Very fun escape the room that works great with VR. 
Lasts for about 30-45 min.

30345811.review: I've played other VR room escapes, and this one so far is the best I've come across.

30318070.review: Kinda short, but was still a lot of fun to play. They have a bunch of cool features!

30285777.review: Enjoyed it, but a bit pricey for an hour's worth of exploration... would have been much better with a reward of some sort for escaping.

30271406.review:
Its cool as heck bros.
One might say it's HECKA cool

30271287.review:
Abode made me feel stupid until I felt smart! I spent about 2 hours in the room exploring everything, playing with the drone, and even when the game was done I used the drone to carry the desk lamp into the dark hallway to explore the darkness. So much fun!

The puzzles could be a bit harder. There was only one that really stumped me for a while. It was such a great discovery when I finally figured it out from across the room.

The polish is real nice. The physics could use some work. I had a couple things accidentally shoot across the room. There's no story which is a bit of a shame. I was really wondering why I was locked inside this room.

All in all, it's a fun little experience that's worth the price of a good cheeseburger and some fries!

30264889.review: This game is really fun! It is short with a rather dull ending, but totally worth the $7.99 USD sale price. The achievements are really easy and entertaining as well. I hope to see more from this developer in the future. Highly recommend this to anyone with a VR headset. This is a great introductory game to vr for anyone! 10/10

30262460.review:
This is really the best room escape game available at the moment.

Positive:

 + game mechanics work very well
 + really good puzzles with a good variation in difficulty
 + nice achievements

Negative:
 - for one hour of game, it is at the upper limit of price
 - there is not more of this game :)

30252683.review: A very good escape the room VR game. Graphics, sound, control, and overall immersion is great. The puzzle side is rather well done too. Personally i have no experience with puzzle games and it took me about 50 minutes without prior knowledge to escape.

30228807.review:
This gem of an escape room game has several different kinds of riddles that fit very well in the VR experience. It may be a little bit short, but there is a lot to discover.
I like it, played it twice, and can easily recommend it.

30224763.review: Nice balanced puzzles, diverse and decent difficulty level. Spend around  1 hour to 'escape' and had plenty of fun meanwhile.

30161811.review: I love it. Perfect pacing, perfect difficulty. I wish there was a lot more but worth the price.

30069420.review: Fun room-scale puzzle game.  Took about an hour to complete.

29907714.review:
Note: I received a free license to the game as part of a Reddit promotion to celebrate Touch integration. There was no expectation of a positive review.

Summary: Surprisingly fun escape room game. Not hard for experienced players, but a few puzzles do make you think. Estimates of a 60 minute play time are about right - considering "actual reality" escape rooms are $35 to $60 per person for an hour, the $10 price tag seems fair for fans of the genre.

Additional Comments: I played Abode after I Expect You To Die (IEYTD) and Please Don't Touch Anything (PDTA), other games that could be considered escape rooms. It compares favorably to both, as a true room scale escape room experience - the first I've done in VR.

In comparison to IEYTD, Abode falls a bit short on pure polish: there is less humor, no voice over/narration/story, and perhaps most importantly, Abode's puzzles appear to have only one solution where IEYTD rewards creativity. On the plus side, Abode's one overarching situation (vs. the episodic approach of IEYTD) and more mobility makes for a great feeling of immerson. IEYTD is also $25 on Oculus Home for about 2 hours of content (vs. about 1 hour for $10 for Abode), so Abode is a much easier financial entry point.

Please Don't Touch Anything is less an escape room vs. a series of independent puzzles, so it's harder to compare. That said, PDTA has more puzzles and is significantly harder, so it lasts much longer. On the flip side, Abode has more variety, all objects are interactible, it was built for room scale, and it has better Touch integration (PDTA is kind of janky and works better as a controller game). Though I love PDTA, I think Abode edges it out for fun; PDTA gets the win if you're looking for real brain bending puzzles.

Touch integration is quite good, though see my suggestions below. Rift players should know the following:
1. Many things must be picked up from the floor, so be sure your setup supports this (no problem for me, 3 camera 8 foot x 8 foot setup). If you have trouble, download Steam VR Advanced Settings and use the "Floor Fix" option to set the floor a bit higher in-game than in reality.
2. Front-facing setups should be fine, note that the joystick does snap turns (I didn't see this documented anywhere).
3. One puzzle requires physical poses; if the pose moves your controllers out of the view of the sensor, the puzzle won't "progress". Reposition yourself (maybe step back, or bend your knees a bit) until something happens. Hope this makes sense when you get there. (I'm tall, so my hands graze the ceiling when over my head - apparently I have a small dead zone 1" from the ceiling - though I didn't notice this in VR Sports Basketball).

A few suggestions to the developers:
1. The Touch controls are good, but the interaction model feels a little "off". Most Touch games use the grip button to grab/hold, and trigger to use. Abode uses trigger to grab, and A to use (sometimes, others it's a physical action). Similarly, I'm used to Arizona Sunshine's implementation of teleport: just push the stick to pick your location, and release it to teleport. Abode's "A" button laser took a while to get used to, and it's hard to teleport with some things in your hand.
2. A controller layout diagram or more controller help would be useful, I struggled a bit to figure out how to do some things.
3. The alternate ending is hilarious and took me by complete surprise. However, it could confuse some people (no spoilers), and could be considered "off color" by some. Considering I want my 11-year old daughter to play, it would be nice to have an option to turn it off. However, I totally appreciate the auto-save immediately before, allowing me to easily see the normal ending.
4. I'd love an option for a timer. Having a countdown clock (say, a 60-minute default that you could adjust based on difficulty level) would add a level of tension that's currently missing. Running out of time could just prompt a message like, "You're out of time. Continue from here, or restart in Hard mode?" (which could be a 30-minute timer).
5. Personal preference, but I wish the "hint" disks were colored differently from "needed" disks. Some hints were too good, making a tricky puzzle easy. It would be nice to be able to skip those and only "use" them when I got stuck.

Overall, the suggestions above are minor and didn't detract from the game. Nice job to the devs, and I look forward to having my daughter play through.

29890711.review: Very much like a real life "Escape Room" game we did near us. If you like stuff like that, then this is a good hour-long puzzle for you.

29870286.review: The best room escape game I've played on Vive so far! :) Awesome graphics, nice puzzles.

29798889.review: Un muy buen escape room. Cuidado y sin prácticamente fallos.

29789102.review:
Very well executed escape the room game. I can definitely recommend it, it's very fun.
Don't expect more than an hour of playtime though.

29770899.review:
My first "Escape the Room" game in VR and I think I am a bit spoiled by this one. Nice atmosphere and good puzzles that are not too hard and not too easy (my final one was the globe - kicked myself in the end). 

Took me almost dead on an hour to finish so you can judge yourself whether it is worth the cash.

29545965.review: A decently polished Escape Room game with a terribly childish ending that detracts from the quality of the experience. Took less than 40 minutes to finish, so it's a bit expensive for what it's worth.

29473545.review: Excellent room escape game.  I got about 2 hrs of gameplay, probably would of been less if I did not experience a bug that threw me off.  It was worth the $10.  If I had to appraise this game, I would value it at $7.23, just because there isn't any replayability once it's solved and it is short.  It would be cool if one room led to another, and if the ending had a better reward, the ending didn't exactly invoke that feeling of closure, it felt more like a question...is this it?, Overall I enjoyed it and I was sad there wasn't more.

29455895.review:
Fun and well polished game with lots of interactive puzzles. There are hints to unlock things, but recommend playing around until you get stuck and need to start using them. 

Highly recommend, but I did hit a couple of glitches:
- Teleporting with objects in my hand would cause them to fly off somewhere in the room. Worked around by tossing items where I needed them :)
- At one point a key got stuck (or maybe I just didn't figure out to turn it?)... I ended up calling it a night and next day after restart things worked. I didn't realize the key was stuck so probably added an extra 20 mins to playtime.

29455388.review: Abode, a short and sweet escape the room game with a 50s retro-future aesthetic has you explore an apartment at your leisure, searching for clues to solve puzzles and eventually make your way to freedom. It’s about 1-2 hours long, depending on your powers of observation, and has an easter egg or two for those who go the extra mile.

29436745.review: Awesome! Made me think a bit, some puzzles were immediate and some took some tinkering but they all were fairly satisfying.

29391236.review:
The full game takes about 45 minutes to an hour to complete and doesnt have too much replayability, but I definitely feel that I got my money's worth with Abode. It has a few decent puzzles and the atmosphere of the game is really great; the stylized visuals and the ambient audio worked together to create a fairly cohesive tone to the limited world.

The game has its negatives; the controls can be wonky at times and the game physics weren't super tight, but for a few bucks its a fun experience. Would definitely reccomend to people who enjoy puzzle games or classic point and click adventures.

29387141.review:
I don't want to leave a bad review for this game, because there are so many cool things about it.  

Another one of those moments where you wish Steam had more than an all or nothing rating system.  Since this game is in the "Very Positive" zone I think it's okay to not recommend it and have the game still be in the positive, because I think it deserves as much.  

The atmosphere and puzzles were fun and engaging.  I really liked that you could puff on the cigar or put the hat on.  I think it's the first VR game where you can put on a hat as far as I know.  I accidently knocked over the hat rack and couldn't seem to pick it back up so I just put the hat on my head and forgot about it.  

There was a little tiny bit of buggyness to grabing objects.  This seems to be the case in even the most polished VR games right now so you can only really expect so much.  All the puzzles were fun, but it was a quick play through.  That would have to be my only complaint.  I know most people don't like getting stuck on puzzle games, but personally I prefer something slightly more challenging than this.  

If the price were a little cheaper than $10 I'd say go for it, but I would probably regret paying $10 bucks for it myself.

I was lucky enough, and the devs were generous enought to offer me a key for free, which again makes me really reluctant to not recommend it fully.  It truly is a very cool experience, but if I can't make enough money to afford the game in the same amount of time it takes me to complete it, that equates to buyer's remorse for me.  

All it would need is a bit of plot or narrative, or one or two puzzles that stump you without being rediculously counter-intuitive to logic.  

The end did make me laugh out loud though.  

If you decide to pick it up I hope you enjoy it.  It's definitly worth a sale price, just simply too short for $10 at this time.

29373698.review: I liked it a lot. Haven't played a lot of escape room games, but this I played from start too finish in one standing (it's a bit on the short side though). It's quite polished, and the puzzles made sense. I didn't feel stuck for more than a few minutes troughout the whole game. Recommended. I'll think I'll check out more games in the genre, allthough I heard this is one of the better ones.

29365226.review: I had a ton of fun with this. It's pretty well polished too! I highly suggest this title.

29312193.review: Loved the game and didn't mind the relatively short length. But man, that ending. Come on guys... This isn't an early access game. A full and final game shouldn't end like... that.

29309396.review: This game was great! The puzzles were challenging and rewarding. I admit, I got stuck here and there, but I managed to figure stuff out. And the ending... I was a little disappointed at first, but afterward I can't help but think of it fondly. The contrast of the buildup to the payoff is incredible. I would certainly recommend. Plus, hey! Cheap-ish. For VR games nowadays, that is.

29289888.review: Great game! Challenging puzzles but not too difficult with a fantastic payoff!

29259749.review: This is one of the best virtual reality "escape the room" games of 2016.  It's got a very nice atmosphere, visuals and sound as well as good, well thought out puzzles. For me it was about an hour of playtime. A minor downside is that the puzzles are not grounded in reality; they just exist for being puzzles. However: if you are into escape games, get this one!

29258921.review: If you like escape rooms, you will like Abode. Of the escape room games I've played on the Vive, this is by far the best. I beat it in about 45 minutes, which isn't terribly long, but I would consider it well worth the price. Additionally, the acheivements offer some other objectives outside of advancing the puzzles which is a welcome addition. Overall I definitely recommend this game :p

29246282.review:
One of the best escape room games I've played and the only VR Game I played so far where you can interact with everything. (It doesn't matter if you need it for the story and progress or not).

Some nice puzzles to solve in a nicely designed environment. Took me around 1 1/2h to beat the game.

Sometimes some items glitch in places where you can't reach them. To fix this simply open the menu and reload your save file. No progress is lost but some item positions are reset.

A time limit (normal escape rooms have a time limit of 1h) would be nice to add some pressure.

29243692.review: Echt gutes Spiel, es gibt viele Objekte zum greifen und viele kleine Puzzles die man lösen muss um aus dem Raum zu entkommen.

29215195.review:
One of my favorite "laid back" VR experiences.  Really beautiful visual and sound design, fun puzzles, and incredibly satisfying interaction.

None of the puzzles are difficult, but it's still very enjoyable.

29193030.review:
Great game! Every challenge was unique and entertaining, and there were so many different things to do. I completed the game in just under an hour, which makes it worth the price to me, even though I bought it on sale.

The only thing I might change is adding an option to not have the clues for an "expert" mode or something. Some of the clues made a challenge obvious.

29154907.review:
Abode is a fun and challenging room escape game. It makes decent use of roomscale, and has nice controller models that make it grabbing with fine detail pretty easy. The graphics were simple but well executed. Combined with the jazzy music, it felt like a futuristic detective-noir setting, which totally fits the platform and gameplay.

The puzzles are not overly difficult, but still satisfying. I only got caught up on one towards the end. Overall, it still had a nice pacing.

I don't want to spoil the ending, but I'll say that while it felt a little out of place, I couldn't help but laugh and enjoy it.

Overall, this is a well polished VR game, and one that I really enjoyed. I'm not sure how much I will replay it myself, but I can definitely see myself showing it off to others. I got this game on sale, and would definitely recommend it for the $5 that I paid. I'm not sure now if I would pay $10, but it might be a no-brainer for someone who shows off their Vive a lot or is a huge room escape fan.

29126106.review: I thought this was an awesome escape game.

29076743.review: Really enjoyed this game. There are a number of clever things that make the experience unique with plenty of "ah-ha" moments. Graphics, gameplay, controls, all two thumbs up. I hope the developer puts out more content like this!

29069331.review: Very good escape game, good use of the controllers and the room. Also the possibility to move around the room virtually was much appreciated, since my play area isn't that big.

29044252.review: Absolutely the best escape-the-room game in VR

29042925.review: Very enjoyable. Best room escape game I've tried.

29040398.review: An enjoyable little escape the room experience. Not super long, I beat it in about 70 minutes, but polished and satisfying nonetheless.

29038325.review:
Overall I liked this game, and progressing through the room, however, I'm not sure the value is really there for what you pay for. The ending is especially cheap, and the first thing I thought was "Wait, didn't I pay for this?" Yeah, it's an ending so cheap, and you paid for the privilage.

Otherwise, gameplay, yeah, that's fine. The puzzles/clues weren't too difficult to pick up on, and the mechanics of the game worked well. I liked how the little clue system operated. It's awesome getting to put records on a record player and hearing the music. Overall it feels a little short, and that's where it looses some of the value in relation to it's price tag (10 as of writing this). All the sudden I hit the end and thought, was that it? And yeah, then that ending, and hm. I wanted to go back to the good ol' days, when I was still finding clues and digging through boxes.

29037438.review: It's a pretty short experience (as the devs even mention in the description), but the scene's polish is quite nice. 28989901.review: Good puzzles, great ending.  A few bugs could ruin your game so be careful.  I had to restart after a missing key (post 31 December update even) and got another object stuck in the wall.

28979944.review: This was an excellent implementation of a VR escape game. It really captured the spirit of one, and had a good variety of puzzles. I would gladly buy and play sequels to this.

28969180.review: Fun, somewhat challenging but not too hard. I liked the twist ending.

28961855.review:

Wer diese Art von Spiel mag, darf hier bedenkenlos zugreifen. Mir hat es sehr viel Frude bereitet. Meinen Dank dafür an die oder den Entwickler. 
Punkte 8/10

28954466.review: Cute, interesting puzzler. I didn't finish it yet but got pretty far - worth it!

28951618.review: This has been my favorite VR escape room so far out of five or so.

28928472.review:
I've been to a number of escape rooms, so far my group has never failed to escape.
This game is reminiscent of those, it has many puzzles, many vauge clues and I went bouncing around trying different things and seeing what new itmes could unlock what new things.
For the price, its half of what I would normally pay for 1 hour in a group escape room, and I solved this in 55 minutes.
I was impressed with the puzzles and the variety - even if a lot of it is finding out what fits where it takes a while to figure it all out. It truly is a hunt to upturn the entire room to find all the bits your need.
While I got frustrated a few times, I persevered and made it through with only short periods of no progression and a lot of little steps forward. I want to see more escape room games made like this.

If you like escape room style puzzle solving (this is a lot of find the item that you can use to find the code to unlock the whatever, etc) games I definately recommend this.

I do have a comment for the devs - ha ha ha. yeah. no. Even if you just change the end to a key to unlock the door that never opens, that would be an improvement on the ending.

28925816.review: This game took me about an hour to complete. It was great fun, interesting puzzles, but nothing stumped me. $10 is pretty hefty for a game of this scale but it shows the potential of VR much better than most of the other games you'll find at this price.

28924939.review: I checked out this minigame because I heard it was one of, if not the best, escape-the-room minigames currently available. Yeah... not a chance. It's "fine", just completely unremarkable (really lame ending too). As far as escape the room minigames go, I suggest checking out [i]I Expect You to Die[/i]. That one is probably the best this worthless little genre will ever be, and even still I wouldn't really recommend it to gamers since escaping the room should always just be a minigame inside of a larger game.

28876814.review: This game was a very entertaining hour long puzzle/room escape game. Would highly recommend.

28834162.review:
Fun little escape game, buggy but a good time.
Only good for one playthough yourself; once you know the game you can charge through easily.

Had my run incompletable due to an item seemingly disappearing, and didn't realize it for quite a while.
Still, once I did it wasn't very hard to get back through and not lose the item the second time around.

Definitely recommended, doubly so if you go around showing off your gear.
Just don't expect much replayability if you don't; on sale, the price is still worth it easily.

28834099.review:
This is a great little puzzle/escape game. Puzzles are all pretty straighforward but they feel nicely satisfying and the overall design is relatively simple but nice. Also you can wear a hat.

On the downside, as nice as it is I finished it in under an hour. I bought it on sale at £3.50 and for that price I think it was a few quid well spent, but at twice the price it is pretty damn brief. My advice would be to grab it on sale but I wouldn't buy it full price unless you have cash to burn.

28809490.review: Thoroughly enjoyable locked room puzzle with a great payoff. Hats off to the devs!

28796896.review: If you like puzzle/escape rooms and VR, this is the game for you.  It's short, but it's worth the price.

28795817.review:
This is a good escape game that seems like it may take a while to finish. I'm not sure if it bugged out, and things are missing (a key) or if I'm simply not figuring it out. There's a lot going on in the room.

28636889.review: This is a smooth escape puzzle room...get it!

Bis auf ein paar kleinere Bugs läuft es Super ich musste das Spiel 2 mal neu starten, 
- Einmal ist ein schlüssel verschwunden hatte ihn weder im Inventar noch lag er aufm Boden.
- Nachdem ich das Puzzle mit den Blauen karten richtig zusammen gesetzt hatte ging es auch erst nach ein neustart des Spiels weiter.

Auf jedenfall lohnt sich der kauf, ich hoffe es kommen noch mehr Räume.

28299569.review: Great puzzles, great visuals, and the right amount of difficulty. Like others have said, this is the best Escape Room so far. The pacing is right and everything was intuitive enough. I also appreciate that its a non-creepy atmosphere. VR devs seems to really love their dark and scary moods. I'm glad that there are games like this that are more laid back and whimsical.

28299492.review: Loved this game!! If you like escape games you will absolutely love the game too!

28293953.review: Le meilleur escape room que j'ai joué pour le moment !

28247875.review:
I've played a bunch of VR escape rooms and this is one of the best. It does a great job of giving you slow progress and hints within the context of the world. The puzzles are very clean and require the right amount of lateral thinking, and non-linear enough that you always have a few mysteries to solve. The art is very well designed for this type of game, low noise so it can focus your attention on the important details. It's also nice having an inventory so you can move while carrying several things.

Very simple and short, but I enjoyed every moment of it.

28229565.review: Escape rooms are pretty much the one genre that I don't think I'll ever get tired of, especially in VR, but I have to admit that a lot of the releases in the recent tides of escape room VR games have been kind of mediocre (which to be fair is pretty much the same as real-life escape rooms, which in my experience vary dramatically in quality). Abode is not one of those games. Pretty much everything about it is well-designed and high quality, there's lots of things to interact and play with, and it even has a little detective fedora that you can put on your virtual head while you solve its puzzles. The thing that's hard to explain but easy for anyone who's played a VR game to understand is how important that sort of thing is. When you can pick up a lit cigar that has nothing to do with any of the puzzles and pull an unlit cigar from a case and touch the ends together to light the unlit one, it's an insignificant action, but it does a lot to give you a sense of presence in the game, and Abode does that sort of thing really well. It's on the longer end of the spectrum as far as length goes, so you can get at least a little under an hour out of it. It's hard to say much without talking too much about the game, but if you like escape room games you'll love Abode. Escape!VR has been my favorite escape game ever since it came out, and it's still great, but Abode just took that seat.

28225548.review:
Hell yes! One of the best games for Vive! I love it  :)

Please make more games like this but with additional rooms!

28212390.review: This is one of the best experiences I have had with a vr game in a while. It's fun, different, and an overall great time. The Film Noir style helps you keep immersion with the odd, but yet realistic puzzels. Each puzzel is well crafted and creative. They're not too hard, yet not easy and straight forward. Each one leades to another in a way which you are never stuck and you know where you should focus on next. At the time I was bought it other players and I ran into a small glitch where the mail shoot wasn't magnetic and wouldn't grab the pipes, but after a quick restart of the game it fixed itself and I was able to solve it. Other people are complaining the ending was odd and didn't match the style, but I quite liked it and was a "satisfying" end. My only complant is the price, I think 10$ is too much for the 45 minutes (how long it took me) of gameplay, and I can not justify keeping it and never playing it again. That is why I returned it, and I hate to not support the creators and get a "free pass," but if they were to add another room I would gladly rebuy it and keep it.

28211881.review:
Short:  If you like escape room games, then get this.  Overall, this is a well designed game.  It has some good puzzles and some easy ones.  The overall play time is roughly an hour [or a lot more], which is the appropriately length for an escape room game.  For escape rooms, I feel that the game-play/puzzle element is the most important aspect of the game.  This game does it well (for the most part) in that regard.  Some may not get over the cartoon art style.  But when you're busy solving puzzles, you don't even think about it.  It just so happens that I do like the art style and presentation of the game.  So, that's a bonus.

Long:  [SPOILER ALERT:  FEEDBACKS - STOP READING IF YOU DON'T WANT TO RUIN YOUR EXPERIENCE]  :-)

While I enjoyed playing this game overall, I felt that some of the gameplay could be improved.  I feel that a lot of the clues were unnecessary.  They practically tell you where to go and get items or figure things out.  For example:

1- The main computer code
2- The drawer hidden compartment
3- The broken brick
4- The trash can
5- The email pipe map

It would be a lot more rewarding to discover these on your own.  They are not hard to begin with (maybe except the brick).

Instead of giving away clues, maybe incorporate a hint system into the game where users can request these clues as needed.

Or have difficulty levels.  Add clues for easy level and no clues for difficult level.

Other than those, I had fun playing this game.  Even in its current state, I would not hesitate to recommend this game.  It's just that it could be more rewarding in the end knowing you got all those items on your own.

Thanks and looking forward to more escape rooms!

28206867.review:
Abode is a marvelous Sci-fi experience within VR.

Every aspect in the game feels polished and friendly to any skill level gamer.
Budget about an hour to an hour and a half for the full game. 
If you are into "escape the room" games, then this is the one for you. The puzzle's are fun and engaging, yet give enough challenge to merrit a commited effort for completion.

I wont give any spoilers, but its worth the time, and I look forward to watching my wife and kids take turns experiencing the depth Abode offers.

28198646.review:
Pretty good!
About an hour's worth of play, with a nice clean art style, a couple of fun sound tracks, and puzzles that never stumped me for more than a moment or two.  (It doesn't have too many chokepoints, so if you get stuck on one, try another.)
The devs got me good at the end though - the scamps!

28197107.review: Very clever escape the room game with some fun elements, but at only 30-45 minutes of gameplay, it is not worth $10. I also experiances some crazy physics bugs that made it hard to play, items zooming across the room, items that could not be picked up. But dispite that, it is a very well made game.

28196930.review: Definitely one of the better "Puzzle Room" VR games I've played yet. The interactivity wasn't perfect, and the physics could get a little buggy, but some of the things you could do with the controls were really innovative for the genre. I would definitely recommend this to any puzzle room / escape the room fans.

28196326.review: This is one of the best VR puzzle rooms I've played so far.  Sadly, the ending ruined a great deal of my enjoyment.

28195563.review: I finished in about 50mins and liked every minute of it. The art style and in-game music worked for me.

28191622.review:
This is what i'm talking about! Contains several really cool concepts and it's very polished. it's about 1-2 hrs of playtime but I loved the setting so much i'm probably going to re-play it several times in the future. 

Only complaint is the ending, which maybe isn't  a relevant complaint since all the puzzles were great, but still i think you could have done something really cool instead of um.. well i'm not going to spoil.

28188282.review:
A good escape room. Well designed, non-linear progression and the puzzles all make perfect sense.

Still, I got it done in 45 minutes it's up to you whether that's worth $10.

28154828.review: Fun and rewarding puzzle game that was exactly what I was looking for on the vive. Some of the humor didn't really work for me but nonetheless recommended.

28151631.review:
+ Beautiful lowpoly Artstyle which lends itself very well to VR
+ You can actually use both your hands simultaneous to do something usefull
+ Varied and fun puzzles
I especially liked the holodesk bit, were you could detach and attach notes in mid air. I want this in my workroom please.
The ball-maze was a surprise too. Really smart way to use the hand mechanics. The third music disc though--- was just weird.

28139450.review: Well done room escape game, even though the ending didn't fit the futuristic style.

28131530.review:
This is the 4th escape room I've tried, and I must say it's my favorite.  So many cool objects and the environment was very polished.  The puzzles were also reasonable.

Perhaps the hints could be optional and replaced with funny quotes or something.

I thought the price was just right.  Everyone wants it cheaper but when you think about it, a real escape room is about $25-30 per person.  

I highly recommend this one!   Hope to see more games from you in the future.

28128720.review:
Abode is a scifi-noir styled, escape the room game. Beautifully stylized and fun! Check out the full review below:

28086864.review: Really well done.  Not on the difficult side, as the hints keep you moving along (I would've liked them optional), but highly polished and some really cool ideas I haven't seen in this genre yet!

28028699.review:
Great escape the room game. The way you collect hints is really good!

I wish this could go on for longer - how about letting the door in the back open into another room??

26964793.review:
Highly enjoyable escape room style game with an interesting theme and great atmosphere.
Length is reasonable for the price, but a bit high only when compared to other similar VR offerings at this point.  
Has a good variety of tasks to complete.
Manipulation of objects is smooth
The only negative I can muster is that the ending is rather disjointed and immersion breaking.

Abode is definitely one of the more enjoyable escape rooms out there at this point!

26552519.review: This is the 3rd "escape the room" VR game Iv played and this one is by the far the most polished one yet.  Defentally worth the $10 price tag!! Plus the developer is going to add new content. They stated that they are aiming for 90 min of gameplay.

26512613.review:
This is the best "escape the room" game I've played on the Vive.
Very well polished. Fun atmosphere. And the puzzles weren't crazy hard.
Get it!

26511185.review: One of the best escape the room games on steam right now. Get it :-)

26499239.review: Lots of features/abilities/stuff you can do, but much of it was pretty obvious. Not bad, No replayability. Great start, I hope the devs keep working on this game type. I think it has a ton of potential.

26433824.review: Polished Escape Room game, feels solid and professional. No clipping through walls or doors, no dropping an object only to be unable to pick it up again. The art style is very effective with neat little touches like the record player with interchangeable LP's and a volume control. The best of this genre i've played.

26432099.review:
Very nicely done escape-the-room game set in a futuristic apartment. Includes some interesting ideas and a high amount of polish.

Some may consider the price too high for a game that's 30 minutes if you're very quick, but I think this is also something worth having guests play, thus multiplying the effective play time, so the price is OK.

26402845.review: Kurz, aber wirklich sehr schön. Gute Grafik, nette Rätsel, kreative Ideen. Absolut empfehlenswert.

26374022.review:
這是一款不錯的逃脫遊戲，我還沒完全破關不過至今為止他都是一款乾淨明亮而且沒有恐怖要素的逃脫遊戲

26358701.review:
Ein tolles Escape-Room-Spiel, was nicht zu schwer und nicht zu einfach ist. Die Steuerung funktioniert prima, die Grafik sieht sehr gut aus und ruckelt nicht. Es sind einige sehr nette Ideen dabei, wie man an diverse benötigte Gegenstände kommt, ich sag nur Drohne :-)  
Ich kann das Spiel sehr empfehlen und hoffe, es kommen noch mehr Räume!

[u]Positive Merkmale:[/u]
[list]
    	[*] Ein Escape-Room-Spiel für Normalsterbliche, nicht zu schwer, nicht zu leicht
    	[*] Tolle und ruckelfreie Grafik
	[*] Sehr nette und neue Ideen
	[*] Steuerung funktioniert gut
[/list]

[u]Negative Merkmale:[/u]
[list]
	[*] Nach ca. 30min vorbei, ich möchte mehr Räume :-)
[/list]

Ich habe auch ein Let's Play in meinem [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ok91FKp_SAtxhz63Ti3KQ]YouTube-Kanal[/url] aufgenommen:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T3Q54ikVPF0

26358053.review:
Abode is a very well made mystery/escape the room game. I loved feeling clever when i figured out how to solve a particular puzzle. The interactions were great, inventory worked seamlessly, the detail of the world was fleshed out with many objects to grab, having a record player in the world to change music was a nice touch, and the payoff was - well, I wont spoil it for you.

It took me about 35 minutes to explore everything. Cant wait to see how the game evolves !

26352486.review:
《公寓》(Abode)是一款以密室逃脱为主题的游戏，玩家被困在一个公寓的房间内，要做的就是解开这些环环相扣的密码与谜题，最终逃离。
　　场景精致度极高，道具量非常大，能让玩家好好地进行一番探索与思考，且当中的部分道具带有蓝光，颇具科技感，令人惊喜。谜题设定较为合理，只要多花一些时间，仔细观察房间内的道具设定，找到对应的物品，就能解开。
　　Steam商店中，该游戏售价为36元人民币，价格比在现实中体验一次同档次的密室逃脱游戏低得多，且玩家可以好好地在其中享受解谜乐趣，喜欢的玩家可以下载来体验。
　　原文链接：http://www.83830.com/game/201611/184007328.shtml

26352485.review:
In a nut shell, another entry in the small and fun Escape Room VR genre. I wouldn't say that it was too challenging, a lot of the puzzles seemed quite obvious to me though, for others it could be different.

It took me roughly 20 minutes to complete it and for that, I don't believe that the $10 price tag is worth it. Though, I still enjoyed it and the ending made me chuckle!

26345936.review: Best escape room on the vive so far!
